paper_abstract: This article aims to present a constrained gestural interface which allows to easily experiment spatial geometry for educational purposes. It consists in a bi-manual gestural language specifically designed in order to simplify user's interaction in geometric constructions. As the inherent complexity of geometry in 3 dimensions is combined with the cognitive difficulty of interacting with virtual environments, we propose to constrain the interaction: hand postures constrain the object type for designation and selection; objects already selected constrain the construction process; the degrees of freedom representation constrain the manipulation of constructed figures; and the deformable ray-casting method constrain the navigation.
paper_title: Constrained gesture interaction in 3D geometric constructions
